TypeSignature.Value: Public Class UsbDevice Inherits Object Implements IDisposable, IJavaPeerable, IParcelable
public ref class UsbDevice : Java::Lang::Object, Android::OS::IParcelable, IDisposable, Java::Interop::IJavaPeerable
public class UsbDevice : Java.Lang.Object, Android.OS.IParcelable, IDisposable, Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable

.class public auto ansi beforefieldinit UsbDevice extends Java.Lang.Object implements class Android.OS.IParcelable, class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable, class System.IDisposable
type UsbDevice = class inherit Object interface IParcelable interface IJavaObject interface IDisposable interface IJavaPeerable

Docs.summary: This class represents a USB device attached to the android device with the android device acting as the USB host.

remarks.para: This class represents a USB device attached to the android device with the android device acting as the USB host. Each device contains one or more UsbInterfaces, each of which contains a number of UsbEndpoints (the channels via which data is transmitted over USB).

This class contains information (along with UsbInterface and UsbEndpoint) that describes the capabilities of the USB device. To communicate with the device, you open a UsbDeviceConnection for the device and use UsbRequest to send and receive data on an endpoint. UsbDeviceConnection#controlTransfer is used for control requests on endpoint zero.

Developer Guides
For more information about communicating with USB hardware, read the USB developer guide.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property DeviceId As Integer
public: virtual property int DeviceId { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a unique integer ID for the device.

remarks.para: Returns a unique integer ID for the device. This is a convenience for clients that want to use an integer to represent the device, rather than the device name. IDs are not persistent across USB disconnects.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property DeviceName As String
public: virtual property System::String ^ DeviceName { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the name of the device.

remarks.para: Returns the name of the device. In the standard implementation, this is the path of the device file for the device in the usbfs file system.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
